title: Silence to noise
narration: For millions, the web sounds like this.
on_screen_text: Millions hear the web like this.

title: Unlabeled icons
narration: Modern sites are filled with icons and custom components that often ship without labels.
visuals: Use <MockBrowser /> + <SkeletonBlock />; target <IconButton />s outlined with <OutlinePulse />; <ScreenReaderStack /> on right.

title: Guessing game
narration: That turns shopping carts, menus, and controls into guessing games.
visuals: Use <ImpactCardRow /> with SVG icons; cards slide in/out.
audio_notes: Short whoosh SFX on each card

title: Logo intro
on_screen_text: WebIlluminator / Illuminate the dark corners of the web.

title: Scan to repair
narration: Here is how it works. It scans for missing labels, tags the UI with visual IDs, sends a snapshot to Gemini, then injects ARIA labels back into the DOM. Under the hood: intent recognition, SPA focus management, and Shadow DOM piercing.
on_screen_text: 1 Scan  2 Tag  3 See  4 Repair / Intent Recognition / SPA Focus Management / Shadow DOM Piercing
visuals: Use <StepRail /> left; right <MockBrowser /> with <ScanningBeam />, <SoMTag />, <GeminiCallout />, and <LabelPill /> (spring). Add <TechChipStack /> upper-right.
audio_notes: Scanning hum begins + light UI blips
notes: Smooth wipe into/out of this section

title: Unlabeled state
narration: Let's watch it in action. On this UI the search, cart, and close buttons are unlabeled.
visuals: Split screen with two <MockBrowser /> states; left shows skeleton content and three unlabeled <IconButton />s with <HighlightRing />.

title: Activation
narration: Press Alt plus R. The page is tagged, Gemini responds, and the labels appear.
visuals: Show <KeystrokeOverlay />, then <ScanningBeam /> sweep; <SoMTag /> numbers and <GeminiCallout /> appear; <LabelPill /> pops in with heavy spring.
audio_notes: Scanning hum + label pop SFX + success chime

title: Labeled state
visuals: Full-frame <MockBrowser /> labeled state; <LabelPill />s remain visible; <CaptionStack /> shows spoken words.

title: BYOK flow
narration: Your key stays in your browser. No backend, no stored data. Screenshots go directly to Gemini, then disappear.
on_screen_text: BYOK / No backend / No data stored
visuals: Use <FlowDiagram /> nodes (Browser, Gemini, Labels, DOM) with connectors.

title: Who wins
narration: Developers get instant fixes. Users get independence. Accessibility improves now, not later.
visuals: Use <BenefitCardRow /> with icon glyphs and soft glow.

title: Final lockup
narration: WebIlluminator. Illuminate the dark corners of the web.
